content:
GOOD THING I MADE A COPY OF THIS MESSAGE. IT TIMED OUT BEING SENT.

I have two gmail accounts, one yahoo, and one hotmail on my HP laptop, running Windows 10.

I've been having server authentication problems with Thunderbird on all of them ('except 'hotmail) since 9/22/21 for incoming mail and 9/17/21 or 9/20/21 for outgoing mail. Each account gives me the "failure while connecting" message. Screen shots attached.

Hotmail often gives me "your email was not sent; try again later" message. BUT it has sent the message and it has been received! Sorry, no screen shot of that error message.

I don't remember the terminology, but I have "listed" Thunderbird as safe/allowed to log in on my behalf with each of my accounts.

From the PC, I am able to log in to all of these email accounts directly with the same user/passwords entered in Thunderbird. My Galaxy S7 Smartphone successfully sends & receives from each of these accounts using a different mail client.

Please let me know if you need information on the server set ups. Until today, I did not realize the extent of this issue. I really need help! Thanks.

title: Need a fix for sites that use e-mail address's for password authentication.
content:
I use the password manager in Firefox. Makes it easier to log in to different sites. I have found a situation that has been overlooked. Multiple sites use a persons e-mail address for identity. Different sites then would all use the one e-mail address for identity. Each site however would have a different password. So we have one "name" but multiple passwords connected to that name. Firefox doesnt realize that the one name has multiple passwords so everytime you login to a site that uses your email address as your identity, it asks if you may want to update your password. You have to refuse everytime because the different sites have a different password. If you update the password, each site will now have the password of the last updated password. Its a issue that needs to be fixed so Firefox recognizes how a Email address=Name can have multiple passwords because different sites are using the same name. It looks like Firefox isnt making the connection that different sites are being visited by the same person so some information will be consistent among different sites visited. Thus not realizing that its correct that the "same" name has a password that is different for this new site.

Is there a workaround? thx.
creator: romeemore

title: Last update
content:
That last update has rendered Firefox unusable for me and other visually impaired people by making the display screen incompatible with Windows accessibility options. The drop down menus are fine, it's the display screen that is now a white background only, instead of the accessible black background with light letters.

I realize this is likely clear as mud, but that white background is illegible to people with poor vision.

I want my browser back. If thee is a way to go back to an earlier build that worked, I'd like to know it. If there is a compensatory add on, I'd like to find it. If your developers have decided visually impaired adults are SOL I suppose that's useful, too.

TIA for any help.

[Personal information removed by moderator. Please read Mozilla Support rules and guidelines, thanks.]

title: Firefox is redirecting to homepage or loading different languages every time I click a link on a site
content:
Hello,

I love Firefox, but lately it is driving me insane! Here is what happens:

Most of the websites I visit, if they have more that 1 language, Firefox loads different language when I load a new page on that site.

For Example: I go to prestashop.com and the site loads in Russian. Then I click Templates in the main menu, and the page is loaded in Polish. Then I click on Modules in the menu and that page is loaded in German. And this happens randomly, not every time.

Second problem: I try to open a product on some online store and it redirects me to the previous page I was in. I try to login in other site and when I click on the login button it redirects me to the previous page again. That happens on many sites I visit, but not all.

I tried cleaning the Cache, Cookies and etc - nothing changed. Reinstalled Firefox and logged with my profile, the problems are still there. If I do not log with my profile Firefox is working normally.

Is there a way to fix this and not by creating new profile, because I have a ton of bookmarks and logins that I don't want to loose?

This is not happening in private mode.
creator: service104
